acts.description: Prohibits the giving or receiving of dowry, aiming to eliminate dowry-related harassment and violence against women.
Criminalizes the practice of sati and its glorification, protecting widows from this harmful tradition.
Prohibits child marriages and provides support to victims, safeguarding young girls from early and forced marriages.

acts.act: Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace Act, 2013
acts.description: Provides protection against sexual harassment at the workplace and outlines procedures for complaint redressal.
Grants daughters equal rights to inherit ancestral property, promoting gender equality in inheritance laws.
Modernizes criminal laws, including provisions addressing offenses like sexual harassment and stalking against women.
Aims to prevent trafficking and exploitation of women for commercial sexual activities.
Establishes procedures for appointing guardians for minors, ensuring the welfare and protection of children, including girls.
Governs the solemnization of marriages among Indian Christians, ensuring legal recognition and protection for Christian women.
Modernizes evidence law, replacing the Indian Evidence Act, 1872, and includes provisions relevant to women's rights in legal proceedings.
Grants married women the right to own and control property independently, safeguarding their financial interests.
Provides compensation to workers, including women, for injuries or death arising out of and in the course of employment.
Provides rules for the inheritance of property, including protections and inheritance rights for Christian women and widows.
Regulates film content in India, helping prevent the objectification and indecent representation of women in cinema.
Enables legal registration of vital events including marriages, supporting women's rights to legal marital status and identity.
Ensures minimum wage standards, protecting women workers from exploitation and wage discrimination.

acts.act: Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012
acts.description: Safeguards children, especially girls, from sexual abuse through stringent punishments and child-friendly procedures.
Applies Islamic personal laws to Muslims in India, affecting women's rights in marriage, divorce, and inheritance.
Prohibits indecent representation of women in media and advertisements, safeguarding women's dignity.
Provides a legal framework for interfaith and civil marriages, ensuring women's rights irrespective of religion.
Governs marriage among Hindus, granting women rights in marriage, divorce, and maintenance.
Regulates marriages of Indian citizens abroad, ensuring legal rights for women in international marriages.
Establishes family courts to ensure speedy and sensitive resolution of disputes involving women, including divorce and maintenance.
Provides maternity leave, benefits, and workplace protections to ensure women’s health and financial stability during childbirth.
Governs adoption and maintenance among Hindus, securing the rights of women to claim maintenance from husbands or relatives.
Replaces the Code of Criminal Procedure, with provisions impacting criminal justice processes including those affecting women’s safety.
Legalizes abortion under specific conditions, expanding women’s reproductive rights and access to safe medical procedures.
Established the National Commission for Women to safeguard and promote women's rights through advocacy and policy review.

acts.act: The Pre-conception and Pre-natal Diagnostic Techniques (Prohibition of Sex Selection) Act, 1994
acts.description: Prohibits sex selection before or after conception to combat female foeticide and gender imbalance.

acts.act: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005
acts.description: Provides protection and remedies for women facing physical, emotional, verbal, or economic abuse in domestic settings.
Governs divorce and legal separation for Christians in India, including provisions for women seeking relief from abusive marriages.
Mandates equal pay for equal work, prohibiting gender-based wage discrimination against women.
Legalized the remarriage of Hindu widows, challenging deep-rooted societal taboos and ensuring their social rights.

acts.act: Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Marriage) Act, 2019
acts.description: Criminalizes instant triple talaq and protects the rights of Muslim women in marriage and divorce.
Recognises gender identity; and discriminating someone based on their gender identity, would amount to violation of their Fundamental Rights

acts.act: Navtej Singh Johar v. Union of India (2018)
acts.description: Decriminalized consensual same-sex relationships by reading down Section 377 IPC.
Protects the rights of transgender persons and prohibits discrimination in education, healthcare, employment, etc.

acts.act: Madras HC Ruling on LGBTQ+ Sensitization (2021)
acts.description: Directed the inclusion of LGBTQIA+ education in curricula and police training.

acts.act: Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016
acts.description: Expands the list of recognized disabilities from 7 to 21, mandates 4% reservation in government jobs, 5% in higher education, and ensures accessibility in public infrastructure, education, and employment.

acts.act: National Trust for the Welfare of Persons with Autism, Cerebral Palsy, Mental Retardation and Multiple Disabilities Act, 1999
acts.description: Establishes a statutory body to provide legal guardianship and promote welfare measures for persons with specified disabilities through community-based support.
Regulates and monitors training programs for rehabilitation professionals and maintains a Central Rehabilitation Register to ensure quality services for persons with disabilities.
Guarantees the right to mental healthcare services, decriminalizes suicide, and ensures informed consent and confidentiality for persons with mental illnesses.
Mandates equal pay for equal work, prohibiting wage discrimination based on sex.

acts.act: Title VII of the Civil Rights Act, 1964
acts.description: Prohibits employment discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

acts.act: Title IX of the Education Amendments, 1972
acts.description: Prohibits sex-based discrimination in federally funded education programs and activities.
Prohibits discrimination based on pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions.
Provides resources and legal remedies to address domestic violence, sexual assault, and stalking.
Establishes minimum wage and overtime protections, benefiting both men and women in the workforce.
Grants up to 12 weeks of unpaid, job-protected leave for childbirth, newborn care, or health needs.
Expands women's access to preventive health services, including contraception, without cost-sharing.
Resets the time limit for filing pay discrimination claims with each discriminatory paycheck.
Requires reasonable workplace accommodations for employees affected by pregnancy and childbirth.
A comprehensive civil rights law prohibiting discrimination against individuals with disabilities in employment, public accommodations, transportation, and more.
Prohibits discrimination on the basis of disability in federal programs and services, federal employment, and by federal contractors; ensures accessibility of electronic and information technology.
Guarantees free appropriate public education to eligible children with disabilities and ensures special education and related services.
Prohibits discrimination in housing based on disability, requiring landlords to make reasonable accommodations.

acts.act: Voting Accessibility for the Elderly and Handicapped Act, 1984
acts.description: Requires polling places for federal elections to be accessible to individuals with disabilities.
Mandates that voter registration services be provided at state agencies serving persons with disabilities.

acts.act: Civil Rights of Institutionalized Persons Act (CRIPA), 1980
acts.description: Authorizes the U.S. Attorney General to address systemic civil rights violations in institutions, including those housing individuals with disabilities.

acts.act: Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (as interpreted in Bostock v. Clayton County, 2020)
acts.description: Prohibits employment discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity under the definition of 'sex'.

acts.act: Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972
acts.description: Prohibits sex-based discrimination in federally funded education programs, interpreted to include sexual orientation and gender identity.

acts.act: Section 1557 of the Affordable Care Act, 2010
acts.description: Prohibits discrimination in health programs and activities on the basis of sex, including sexual orientation and gender identity.

acts.act: Freedom of Access to Clinic Entrances (FACE) Act, 1994
acts.description: Protects the right to access reproductive health services, including protections for LGBTQ+ individuals seeking such services.

acts.act: Matthew Shepard and James Byrd Jr. Hate Crimes Prevention Act, 2009
acts.description: Expands federal hate crime laws to include crimes motivated by a victim's actual or perceived sexual orientation or gender identity.
